docs.title: About me
docs.text: I hold a PhD in applied mathematics from the University of Strasbourg at the Institut de Recherche Mathématique Avancée Mixed Research Unit 7501 from the CNRS. My thesis is entitled Model order reduction method for Hamiltonian dynamics using deep learning.

docs.title: Domain & activity
docs.text:
I am a former member of the MOCO and MACARON teams. My field of research is the model order reduction (MOR) of Hamiltonian systems.

Figure – Shallow water simulation.

docs.title: CEMRACS summer school 2022
docs.text: I participated in CEMRACS 2022 on the theme "Transport in Physics, Biology, and Urban Traffic". I took part in a project titled "Model order reduction in velocity space and learning for the Vlasov-Maxwell equations" which resulted in a publication doi:10.1051/proc/202477213.
